channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside no 143 Chevening Rd, 25th January
item.description:
There are 2 raised slabs, almost forming a small step. I had a nasty fall in the early evening when it was dark. I hurt my knees and lacerated my hands. Although I am elderly I am fit and steady on my feet, and regularly play tennis and practice yoga and walk a lot.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chevening Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drain, 25th January
item.description:
Drain approx15 metre SE of 128 Sevenoaks Way is blocked. When it rains a very beep and broad puddle forms meaning that the footway is impassible for pedestrians going along Sevenoaks Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,2, St. Mary's Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Jumble of building materials causing obstruction and potential road accidents, 25th January
item.description:
Skip for renovation work at 30 Springfield Road, Welling, DA161QW now flanked by palleted and loose building materials. Some of these planks and sheets have potential to fall onto pedestrians or into the road. Photos attached showing that the materials and skip are now using at least 4 times the space required for one skip. This has been recurring and escalating problem for weeks but has now reach new level. Materials should be taken through the house and stored at rear of property. Paid resident parking area with limited availability at the best of times.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park View Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning needed, 25th January
item.description:
Cleaners must put full bags ON TOP of bins. The foxes get into them on the floor. Also, too long a gap between bagging and collecting. Local council members informed - please tell relevant department to get litter pickers to put bags on bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Goodrich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large trees adjacent to 45 Broxbourne Road boundary need pruning. These are within close proximity to our property and can cause danger to the property as well as the public pathway that crosses through Broxbourne gardens. Could we get them inspected and pruned please?, 25th January
item.description:
Large trees too close to neighbouring properties and public walkway passing through Broxbourne garden that need pruning for height and circumference for public and property safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broxbourne Road, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked truck on double yellow line lines, 25th January
item.description:

item.title: Tow truck parked illegally over double yellow lines, 25th January
item.description:
I’ve sent a report before but nothing gets done about it so I’m hoping this time will b different. This guy is so arrogant he thinks he can park where he likes. This truck is parked over double yellow lines and also on a corner causing obstruction and poor visibility of what is coming round the corner. This needs a fine or to be removed. If nothing is done I will be contacting the council about this matter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweet Briar Grove, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
